meanings.definition: More mature or developed in age or character.
meanings.sent1: The apple was riper than the others on the tree.
meanings.sent2: The cheese was riper after aging for a few months.
meanings.sent3: The idea of a talking dog seemed riper than a flying pig.
meanings.sent4: Her skills were riper than a well-aged wine.
meanings.sent5: The riper fruit was sweeter and juicier than the unripe ones.

meanings.definition: Ready for reaping or gathering; fully grown.
meanings.sent1: The wheat field was riper for harvest than the barley field.
meanings.sent2: The grapes were riper this year compared to last year.
meanings.sent3: The joke was riper than the overripe banana on the counter.
meanings.sent4: The opportunity was riper than the fruit hanging low on the tree.
meanings.sent5: The riper tomatoes were perfect for making sauce.

meanings.definition: Having reached the best or most suitable time for something.
meanings.sent1: The weather was riper for a picnic in the park.
meanings.sent2: The moment was riper for a heartfelt confession.
meanings.sent3: The situation was riper than a perfectly timed punchline.
meanings.sent4: The atmosphere was riper than a fully bloomed garden.
meanings.sent5: The riper conditions made for a successful outcome.
